content:
ModelMetadata Class

In this Article

Provides a container for metadata for a model.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ModelMetadata

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ModelMetadata

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The word model is used differently in the context of this class than it is typically used elsewhere. In an ASP.NET Web Forms application, the ModelType attribute of a data-bound control specifies the type of a data element that the data control is bound to. This type is typically referred to as the model, and it typically corresponds to a row in a database table. The properties of the model typically correspond to columns of the table.

A ModelMetadata object can provide metadata for the model itself or for a property of the model, or for a property of a complex property. When the ModelMetadata object pertains to a property, the word model refers to the property, and the word container refers to the model.

For example, the model might be Contact, which has Name and Age properties, and the Name property might be a complex property composed of FirstName and LastName. When the ModelMetadata object pertains to the Contact object, the model type is Contact and there is no container. When the ModelMetadata object pertains to the Name property, the model type is Name and the container type is Contact. When the ModelMetadata object pertains to the FirstName property, the model type is FirstName and the container type is Name.

Constructors summary

ModelMetadata(ModelMetadataProvider,Type,Func<Object>,Type,String)

Initializes a new instance of the ModelMetadata class.

Fields summary

DefaultOrder

An integer value that is always set to 10000.

Properties summary

AdditionalValues

Gets a collection that contains additional metadata about the model.
ContainerType

Gets the type of the container.
ConvertEmptyStringToNull

Gets or sets a value that determines whether empty strings that are submitted in forms should be converted to null.
DataTypeName

Gets or sets the name of the data type.
Description

Gets or sets text that describes the model.
DisplayFormatString

Gets or sets a format string that should be applied when the model is displayed in display mode (as opposed to in edit mode).
DisplayName

Gets or sets the text to use in UI when the name of the model is displayed.
EditFormatString

Gets or sets the format string to use in UI in edit mode.
HideSurroundingHtml

Gets or sets a value that determines whether surrounding HTML should be hidden.
IsComplexType

Gets a value that specifies whether the model is a complex type.
IsNullableValueType

Gets a value that specifies whether the model is a nullable value type.
IsReadOnly

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the model can be updated.
IsRequired

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the property is required.
Model

Gets or sets the model object.
ModelType

Gets the type of the model.
NullDisplayText

Gets the string that should be displayed when the model is null.
Order

Gets or sets an integer that indicates the order in which to display this property relative to other properties.
Properties

Gets a collection of model metadata objects that describe the properties of the model.
PropertyName

Gets the name of the property.
Provider

Gets or sets the provider object for this metadata.
RequestValidationEnabled

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether request validation is enabled.
ShortDisplayName

Gets or sets a short version of the display name.
ShowForDisplay

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the model should be displayed in the UI in display mode (as opposed to edit mode).
ShowForEdit

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the property should be displayed in edit mode (as opposed to display mode).
SimpleDisplayText

Gets or sets text to display for the model when the model represents a complex object
TemplateHint

Gets or sets a value that indicates what template (data control) should be used in UI for the model.
Watermark

Gets or sets watermark text for a text box.

Methods summary

GetDisplayName()

Returns text to display as the name of the model in UI.
GetSimpleDisplayText()

Returns text to display for the model when the model represents a complex object.
GetValidators(ModelBindingExecutionContext)

Returns a collection of validators that apply to the model.

Constructors

  • ModelMetadata(ModelMetadataProvider,Type,Func<Object>,Type,String)

    Initializes a new instance of the ModelMetadata class.

    public ModelMetadata (System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadataProvider provider, Type containerType, Func<object> modelAccessor, Type modelType, string propertyName);

    Parameters

    • provider
      ModelMetadataProvider

      The provider object.

    • containerType
      Type

      The type of the container, or null to create metadata for the model type.

    • modelAccessor
      Func<Object>

      The model accessor.

    • modelType
      Type

      The type of the model.

    • propertyName
      String

      The name of the property, or null to create metadata for the model type.

Fields

  • DefaultOrder

    An integer value that is always set to 10000.

    public const int DefaultOrder = 10000;

Properties

  • AdditionalValues

    Gets a collection that contains additional metadata about the model.

    public virtual System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<string,object> AdditionalValues { get; }

    Property Value

    • Dictionary<String,Object>

      A collection that contains additional metadata about the model.

  • ContainerType

    Gets the type of the container.

    public Type ContainerType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The type of the container, or null if there is no container.

  • ConvertEmptyStringToNull

    Gets or sets a value that determines whether empty strings that are submitted in forms should be converted to null.

    public virtual bool ConvertEmptyStringToNull { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if empty strings should be converted to null; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

  • DataTypeName

    Gets or sets the name of the data type.

    public virtual string DataTypeName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the data type.

    Remarks

    This property can be used to provide additional information about the type of data that is stored by the model. For example, if the ModelType property is set to String, this property might be "EmailAddress" or "Url" â€” that is, a name that indicates more than just that the data is typed as a string.

  • Description

    Gets or sets text that describes the model.

    public virtual string Description { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The description text.

  • DisplayFormatString

    Gets or sets a format string that should be applied when the model is displayed in display mode (as opposed to in edit mode).

    public virtual string DisplayFormatString { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The format string.

  • DisplayName

    Gets or sets the text to use in UI when the name of the model is displayed.

    public virtual string DisplayName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The text to use as the name of the model.

  • EditFormatString

    Gets or sets the format string to use in UI in edit mode.

    public virtual string EditFormatString { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The format string.

  • HideSurroundingHtml

    Gets or sets a value that determines whether surrounding HTML should be hidden.

    public virtual bool HideSurroundingHtml { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if surrounding HTML should be hidden; otherwise, false.

  • IsComplexType

    Gets a value that specifies whether the model is a complex type.

    public virtual bool IsComplexType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the model is a complex type; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Built-in .NET Framework types are not considered complex types for purposes of this property.

  • IsNullableValueType

    Gets a value that specifies whether the model is a nullable value type.

    public bool IsNullableValueType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the model is a nullable value type; otherwise, false.

  • IsReadOnly

    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the model can be updated.

    public virtual bool IsReadOnly { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the model is read-only; otherwise, false The default is false.

  • IsRequired

    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the property is required.

    public virtual bool IsRequired { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the property is required; otherwise, false. The default is true for non-nullable value types and false for all other types.

  • Model

    Gets or sets the model object.

    public object Model { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      The model object.

  • ModelType

    Gets the type of the model.

    public Type ModelType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The type of the model.

  • NullDisplayText

    Gets the string that should be displayed when the model is null.

    public virtual string NullDisplayText { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The string to display when the model is null.

  • Order

    Gets or sets an integer that indicates the order in which to display this property relative to other properties.

    public virtual int Order { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The relative order in which to display this property.

  • Properties

    Gets a collection of model metadata objects that describe the properties of the model.

    public virtual System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata> Properties { get; }

    Property Value

    • IEnumerable<ModelMetadata>

      Metadata for all properties in the model.

  • PropertyName

    Gets the name of the property.

    public string PropertyName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the property if the model is a property; otherwise, null.

  • Provider

    Gets or sets the provider object for this metadata.

    protected System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadataProvider Provider { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ModelMetadataProvider

      The provider object for this metadata.

  • RequestValidationEnabled

    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether request validation is enabled.

    public virtual bool RequestValidationEnabled { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if request validation is enabled; otherwise, false. The default is true.

  • ShortDisplayName

    Gets or sets a short version of the display name.

    public virtual string ShortDisplayName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The text to display when a short version of the model name is required.

    Remarks

    The short display name can be used in a tooltip or in any UI where the complete display name might not fit. If this field is null, the DisplayName property should be used.

  • ShowForDisplay

    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the model should be displayed in the UI in display mode (as opposed to edit mode).

    public virtual bool ShowForDisplay { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the model should be displayed in display mode; otherwise, false. The default is true.

  • ShowForEdit

    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the property should be displayed in edit mode (as opposed to display mode).

    public virtual bool ShowForEdit { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the property should be displayed in edit mode; otherwise, false. The default is true.

  • SimpleDisplayText

    Gets or sets text to display for the model when the model represents a complex object

    public virtual string SimpleDisplayText { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Text to display in UI for a complex object. The default value is determined by calling the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.GetSimpleDisplayText* method.

  • TemplateHint

    Gets or sets a value that indicates what template (data control) should be used in UI for the model.

    public virtual string TemplateHint { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A value that indicates what template (data control) should be used in UI for the model.

  • Watermark

    Gets or sets watermark text for a text box.

    public virtual string Watermark { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The watermark text.

    Remarks

    This property contains text to display as a watermark when a property is rendered for editing in a text box. The default value is null.

Methods

  • GetDisplayName()

    Returns text to display as the name of the model in UI.

    public string GetDisplayName ();

    Returns

    • String

      Text to display as the name of the model in UI. The default is the value of the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.DisplayName* property if that value is not null. If the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.DisplayName* property is null, the default value is the value of the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.PropertyName* property. If the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.PropertyName* property is null, the default value comes from the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.Name* property of the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.ModelType* property.

  • GetSimpleDisplayText()

    Returns text to display for the model when the model represents a complex object.

    protected virtual string GetSimpleDisplayText ();

    Returns

    • String

      The property value is derived by examining the following sequence of related values until a return value is found.

      1. If the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.SimpleDisplayText* property value is not null, that value is returned.

      2. If the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model* property is null, the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.NullDisplayText* property value is returned.

      3. If an attempt to convert the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model* property to a string returns null, an empty string is returned.

      4. If the string conversion of the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model* property value is the same as the stem.Type.FullName* property of the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model* property type, that value is returned.

      5. If there are no properties in the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Properties* collection, an empty string is returned.

      6. If none of the preceding tests have returned a value, the return value comes from the first property in the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Properties* collection. If the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model* property of the first property is null, the stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.NullDisplayText* property value is returned; otherwise the result of converting the first property's stem.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model* property to a string is returned.

  • GetValidators(ModelBindingExecutionContext)

    Returns a collection of validators that apply to the model.

    public virtual System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelValidator> GetValidators (System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelBindingExecutionContext context);

    Parameters

    • context
      ModelBindingExecutionContext

      The model binding execution context.

    Returns

    • IEnumerable<ModelValidator>

      A collection of validators.
